trait.name: Fearful Magic
entries: When a creature fails a saving throw against one of the goth's spells of 1st level or higher, it is also {@condition frightened} of the goth for the duration of the spell.

trait.name: Veil of Death
entries: While motionless, the goth is indistinguishable from a corpse.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blanket of Darkness
entries: The goth melds into an area of dim light or darkness, becoming {@condition invisible} until the end of its next turn or until it makes an attack roll or forces a creature to make a saving throw. While {@condition invisible}, the goth's speed is 0, but, as a bonus action, it can teleport up to 30 feet away to an empty space of dim light or darkness it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pretty face is a 6th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following rouge spells.

trait.name: Charming Magic
entries: When a creature fails a saving throw against one of the pretty face's spells of 1st level or higher, it is also {@condition charmed} by the pretty face for the duration of the spell.

trait.name: White as Snow
entries: The pretty face can communicate simple ideas with tiny beasts such as birds, squirrels, and fish through sounds and gestures.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Ritual Adept
headerEntries: The bait mage is a ritual caster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells as rituals in half the casting time they would normally require.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Commander's Strike
entries: The commander chooses one friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding 3 ({@dice 1d6}) to the attack's damage roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The courtier uses its Rally, if it can. It can then either make a melee weapon attack or take the {@action Dodge} action.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

entries: The courtier chooses up to 3 friendly creatures within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. Each target gains 5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The defender makes one melee weapon attack. If the attack misses, the defender can immediately use its shield bash against the same target.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: The defender bashes its shield against a creature within 5 feet of it. The target makes a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed 5 feet away.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When a creature attacks a target other than the defender within 30 feet of the defender, and the defender can see them both, the defender can move up to its speed. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the target of the attack, the defender can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The dirty fighter can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to one creature it hits with an attack if it has advantage on the attack roll. The dirty fighter doesn't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and the dirty fighter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dirty fighter makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Duelist
entries: The duelist has a +2 bonus to damage rolls with melee weapons it wields with one hand, (included in the attack). It does not benefit from this trait if it is holding an item or wielding a weapon in its other hand.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duelist makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The duelist adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the duelist must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Fist of Unbroken Air
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it is pushed 10 feet and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and each creature other than the bender within 10 feet that can see and hear the bender must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bender makes two Fangs of the Fire Snake attacks.

action.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) fire damage

action.name: Water Whip
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} or pulled up to 25 feet toward the bender (bender's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pulled or knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Glamoured Breastplate
entries: Through illusion magic, the king or queen's breastplate is glamoured to take on the appearance of robes befitting royalty.

trait.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
entries: While wearing this helm, which takes the shape of an opulent crown, the king or queen is magically under the effects of {@spell comprehend languages}.

trait.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
entries: The king or queen is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read their thoughts or determine whether it is lying. Creatures can telepathically communicate with the king or queen only if it allows it. The king or queen chooses whether the ring is visible or {@condition invisible} at will. The king or queen is attuned to this magic item.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. This is a +3 magic weapon.

action.name: Medallion of Thoughts (3/Day)
entries: The king or queen casts {@spell detect thoughts} (spell save {@dc 15}). The king or queen is attuned to this magic item.

action.name: Rod of Rulership (1/Day)
entries: Each creature that can see and hear the king or queen within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the king or queen for 8 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target regards the king or queen as its trusted leader. The effect ends if the king or queen's actions harm the creature or if it is commanded to do something contrary to its nature. The king or queen is attuned to this magic item.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: While the mariner isn't wearing heavy armor or using a shield, its AC is increased by 1.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Scimitar

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Healer's Kit (10/Day)
entries: The medic targets a creature. If the creature is {@condition unconscious}, it is stabilised and regains 1 hit point. Otherwise, it regains 7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) hit points, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of hit dice. A creature must finish a short or long rest before it can receive the latter benefit again.

trait.name: Reckless

trait.name: Siege Warrior
entries: The siege mage deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Battering Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object (a door or a wall). {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. The siege mage requires the assistance of at least one ally to use this ram.

Each creature within a 10 foot radius of that point must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A target can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Shortsword

entries: When the squire takes the {@action Help} action to assist its knight in attacking a creature, the target can be within 30 feet of the squire.

items.name: Saddle Up
entries: If the knight is within 5 feet of the squire and a mount the squire is riding, the squire can use its bonus action to pull the knight onto the mount. The knight takes control of the mount.

reaction.name: Another Set of Hands
entries: At its knight's verbal request, as long as the squire is within 5 feet of the knight and can see the knight, the squire can draw or stow the knight's weapon, put on or take off the knight's shield, or perform the somatic components of the knight's spell.

entries: With the squire's help, its knight can don or doff armor in one minute.

entries: The range of the spell sniper's {@spell fire bolt} and {@spell chaos bolt|XGE} is 600 feet.

trait.name: Wild Magic Surge
entries: When the spell sniper casts a spell of 1st-level or higher, it rolls twice on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table and uses either result.

entries: The templar has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of its position. Additionally, when the templar damages a creature concentrating on a spell, the target has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain concentration.

entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the templar casts a spell, the templar can make a melee weapon attack against that creature. The templar's attack hits before the spell is cast. The target must make a Constitution saving throw as though it were maintaining concentration on the spell. On failed save, the target fails to cast the spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

action.name: Shillelagh Staff
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. This is a magic weapon attack.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The wrestler has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it is grappling.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this attack is stabilised.

action.name: Pin
entries: The wrestler attempts to grapple a creature within 5 feet of it (escape {@dc 15}). On a success, while the target is {@condition grappled}, the wrestler and the target are {@condition restrained}.

skill.special: {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} {@d20 5}, {@item dice set|phb} {@d20 2}, {@item painter's tools|phb} {@d20 5}

trait.name: Scarf of Tongues
entries: While wearing this magic scarf, which takes the form of a ridiculously long green knitted scarf, Will is magically under the effects of tongues.
Will is attuned to this item.

trait.name: Jack of All Trades
entries: When Will makes an ability check for a skill he isn't proficient in, he adds 1 to the result.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Will deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Will that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Will doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Fencing Foil
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Otherworldly Knowledge
entries: Will makes a {@dc 10} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to identify a creature he can see. He has advantage on this roll if the creature has a statblock presented in OUTCLASSED: The NPC

action.name: Statblock Compendium
entries: On a successful roll, he knows the creature's statistics as though he had full access to its statblock and lore (if the target is an NPC) or its character sheet (if the target is a player character).

trait.name: Blank Slate
entries: Add a set of features associated from a class on this page to give this default mage an identity tied to a magical class.

action.name: Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blank Slate
entries: Add a set of features associated from a class on this page to give this default warrior an identity tied to a martial class.

action.name: Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The noble has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The noble has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the noble can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spell.name: Babble
entries: You inflict a curse of uncontrollable bouts of gibberish. Choose a humanoid or fey that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or babble incoherently for the duration. While babbling, the target can't speak, make bite attacks, use breath weapons, or use spells that require a vocal component. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends for the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid or fey for each slot level above 3rd. The humanoids or fey must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Coin Toss
entries: You enchant a coin and flip it. The coin hovers and spins for a split second, then darts towards a creature you can see within range, bursting on impact with a flash of energy. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target. On a hit, roll a {@dice d2}. The target takes 1 force damage on a roll of 1 and 8 force damage on a roll of 2.

m.text: a coin, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases either by 1 on a roll of 1 or by 8 on a roll of 2 when you reach 5th level (2, 16), 11th level (3, 24), and 17th level (4, 32).

spell.name: Despair
entries: You remind your target of the hopelessness of existence. Choose a humanoid or fey that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become despondent. A creature with 5 or less Intelligence or that is immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds on this saving throw. While despondent, the target is {@condition incapacitated}, it automatically fails any ability checks or saving throws made to resist being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, and attack rolls have advantage against it. At the end of each of the target's turns or when the target takes damage, it can make another Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends for the target.

components.m: the skull of a Tiny beast

spell.name: Extract Dream
entries: You extract the ectoplasmic energy of dreams by laying your hands upon a sleeping humanoid or fey. The target makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target's dreams, if it has any, appear in a hazy bubble above its head. The dreams are, by nature, meaningful only to the dreamer. A person viewing the dream in this way can make a DC 20 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check to fathom the meaning of the dream, learning a secret about the dreamer on a success.

If the dreamer is being targeted by the spell {@spell dream|PHB}, a representation of its nightmares materializes as a living nightmare, such as a terrible monster, the caster of dream, or even the dreamer themselves. The living nightmare is any {@filter CR 4|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&4;&—]} or higher creature with the following changes:

items: It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it has immunity to necrotic and poison damage.
It has the {@i {@b Incorporeal Movement}} trait of a {@creature ghost|MM}.
It can't move further than 30 feet from the dreamer.
If the dreamer dies or is no longer {@condition unconscious}, the living nightmare disappears.

If the living nightmare dies, the dreamer can sleep more soundly for a while. If the same caster of {@spell dream} attempts to cast it again on the dreamer in the next 42 ({@dice 4d20}) days, the spell fails.

spell.name: Knight's Hop
entries: You move a creature as though they were a knight on a dragon's chess board. Make a melee spell attack against a Medium or smaller creature within range. On a hit, you move the target in a straight line 10 feet in any direction and then 5 feet in a perpendicular direction, as long as there is space to do so. You can choose to move the target 5 feet and then 10 feet perpendicular instead. Against a willing target, you don't need to hit them with a melee spell attack, you just need to touch them.

components.m: a small carved figure of a horse

spell.name: Mouse
entries: You animate an object with the speed and timidness of a mouse. Choose a Tiny object within range. The target grows four little furry legs and becomes an {@creature animated mouse|OCLD} for the duration, immediately rolling initiative and attempting to escape to a hiding spot. It sees all other creatures as deadly threats, including you.

The effects end if the animated mouse is reduced to 0 hit points (which destroys the object) or if a creature can see the animated mouse when the spell ends. Otherwise, it remains an animated mouse indefinitely.

spell.name: Our Little Secret
entries: You and each willing humanoid or fey touching you when the spell is cast can speak, read, and write {@language Thieves' Cant} for the duration. If no willing creatures are touching you, the spell fails.

components.m: a novel with certain passages suspiciously marked

spell.name: Return to Earth
entries: The earth calls for all manner of creature to coalesce back into its dark soil. Choose a creature within range. At the end of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} if it is within range and it is standing on natural ground.

spell.name: Euphoria
entries: You breathe a puff of sweet-smelling, dizzying gas like that of a faerie dragon. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, roll on the Euphoria Breath Effect table. The target must act accordingly on its next turn.

entries.caption: Euphoria Breath Effect
rows: The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
The target uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. It can otherwise act normally.
The target drops {@condition prone} and immediately ends its turn.
The target takes the {@action Dodge} action and immediately ends its turn.
The target can act normally, but all its attack rolls are made with disadvantage and all saving throws against its spells and effects are made with advantage.

spell.name: Rainbow
entries: A swathe of multicoloured radiance springs forth from your glimmering chest. Choose a creature within range and make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, you deal {@damage 1d10} damage of each of the following types, for a total of {@damage 7d10} damage: radiant, fire, lightning, acid, cold, thunder, and force. You also learn if the target has any vulnerabilities, resistances, or immunities to any of these damage types.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, 7th level, or 8th level, you can add {@damage 1d10} damage of an additional damage type for each slot level above 5th. You can choose from the following additional damage types: necrotic, poison, and psychic. When you cast this spell at 9th level, you instead roll additional damage equal to {@dice 1d10} poison, {@dice 1d10} psychic, {@dice 1d10} necrotic, {@dice 2d10} force, and {@dice 2d10} radiant.

spell.name: Trick
entries: You swap identities with a humanoid you can see within range that is within 1 size category of you. If the target is unwilling, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. On a failure, both you and the target teleport to each other's spaces, switching positions. You both become glamoured to look like each other and speak in each other's voices. The moment of change is not perceptible. To discern through the illusion, a suspicious creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection.
A hag that knows this spell can cast it on two targets other than herself within range. Both targets must either be willing or have failed their saving throw for the change to take place.
